para: This option sets the absolute maximum duration (in seconds) for a gap that the filter will fill with interpolated points.

This is an important safeguard. For example, if you stop your GPS for lunch and restart it an hour later, you almost certainly do not want the filter to draw a straight line across the map connecting the stop and start points. This setting prevents that by defining a time limit beyond which interpolation will not be performed.
If you want to prevent any interpolation, you can set this value to zero.

The pre-defined profiles use the following values: 'walking' (60s), 'running' (120s), 'cycling' (300s), 'driving' (600s), and 'flying' (3600s). If you are using a profile, you do not need to set this option unless you want to override the profile's default.
If you are using a profile, this value is set automatically, but you can override it here.
